sessions.title: "The Soft Parade" - series of 3 minutes pitches
The neurosciene beyond the usability
sessions.description: One of the fields that can be successfully applied to usability testing is neuroscience, which can be used in conducting long-term analyses on what a website’s usability would pose. I will explain how the human brain is implicated in each process used in usability.

sessions.title: Delivering with EmberJS
sessions.description:
I'll try to help you deliver a single page app better and faster.
EmberJS is a modern framework with a mission to make you more productive, built by a community that's pushing the web forward. I'm assuming you haven't delivered an app with it before so I'm starting from scratch. 
We'll use tools specific to EmberJS and we'll talk about components and best practices. It's impossible not to compare EmberJS with other Angular or React, so I'll try to highlight what I think are the benefits that distinguish this framework.

sessions.title: The Comfort Zone Myth
sessions.description: It didn’t take too much time to understand there isn’t a lot of science in what many managers, coaches or leaders preach. At first, I was surprised. Soon, I understood that most of the literature in the personal development field doesn’t serve the readers, but the authors. What does it mean to step out of the comfort zone? Is there any good reason to do so? This is a talk about performance through safety and happiness.

sessions.title: Serverless computing - How to fire your Sysadmin and and run your code in a scalable and secure environment
sessions.description: The future of cloud is serverless computing. All of the major cloud providers are going all-in on this new “serverless" paradigm. Amazon Web Service’s Lambda, Google’s Cloud Functions, IBM’s OpenWhisk, and now Azure’s Functions. This session will cover the basic principles of implementing serverless architectures and zoom into Microsoft's offering in this space: Azure Functions.

sessions.title: Testing mobile in the Cloud
sessions.description: Android has a fragmented ecosystem. There are devices out there with square screens or even no 3G antenna. It’s impossible to test on all of them. But if we write automated tests, then maybe we could run these tests on hundreds of real devices in the cloud. Let’s compare Espresso to Appium and Amazon Device Farm to Firebase Device Lab and see which of these we like more.

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning
sessions.description:
Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects.
You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: Start Writing Modern JavaScript
sessions.description: During this session I will showcase some of the major features behind EcmaScript 2015, which is the new JavaScript standard. We will understand the impact that the new syntax has on our code and we will see how we can leverage the full power of JavaScript today to make our code better.

sessions.title: How to convice your stakeholders to invest in test automation
sessions.description:
1. Track
My session sits best on the following areas: software testing, test automation, promoting test automation, test automation metrics.
2. Session Summary
Test automation! Everybody understands it’s importance but nobody is willing to invest!
I had a really hard time when I had to convince everybody from my organization that we have to start doing test automation, that we need resources for it and that we have to involve everybody in the process and not only testers.
But I didn’t give up and I gathered and gathered arguments and metrics till I convinced them.
I would like to share this experience with CodeComp community and help them with some ideas for how to convince their peers and stakeholders to implement test automation.

3. Session Take Away
My audience can learn from this session:
- arguments for promoting test automation at all levels( developers, testers, project managers, product owners, IT managers).
- Metrics or statistics to use in the test automation lifecycle (in order to monitor the efficiency of test automation in your organization and in order to monitor if test automation is really happening in your organization).
4. Intended Audience
General audience (all roles from software development industry).
5. Previous Speaking Engagements
Tabara de Testare Bucuresti.

sessions.title: Driving (on) the Architecture Runway with SAFe
sessions.description: Driving (on) the Architecture Runway with SAFe

sessions.title: The Elements of Influence: A Generational Assessment of Leadership and Power
sessions.description: We will dive in one of the newest surveys run by Center for Leadership Studies - The Elements of Influence: A Generational Assessment of Leadership and Power. The workshop will focus on leadership as any attempt to influence. Leadership behavior is one of the primary driving forces for productivity, engagement and retention.

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning  (part 2)
sessions.description: Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects. You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: Bringing change:  patterns and people
sessions.description:
In the last few years more and more comapnies begin their journey in Changing the way they work, trying to be more productive, more client-orietend, more pro-active, to offer a better environment for their employees. More and more companies start their journey in the Agile Transformation.

Though each company has its own specific challenges and needs, some issues are raised:
  - Can there be some common patterns and actions they need to take in order to  get where they need? 
  - Where do they actually want to get to? 
  - What do they want to transition into?
  - What are the steps they need to have in mind 
  - What kind of people they need to focus on to move move the company forward?
  - How can those steps be implemented?

In this talk, based on my experience, I will focus on the patters for change, the teams a company needs to create and the profile of people that can move these teams and actions that need to be taken to advance in the desired direction.

sessions.title: Bash on Windows
sessions.description:
We will be talking about the Linux userspace that is built into windows.

We will be looking at how it works, what it can do, what it can't do, and most importantly how it differs from other options.

sessions.title: Looking beyond the code
sessions.description: Code is great and building apps is fantastic. What to do to maximize the chances of building successful apps? And why should we care about this.

sessions.title: Brewing Eisbock with Raspberry PI and Windows 10 IoT
sessions.description:
This presentation focuses on real-life IoT system that supports brewing eisbock beer. Sample device is built on Raspberry PI and Windows 10 IoT. It includes also temperature sensors to measure beer and ambient temperature. There is Windows 10 Universal Application that allows to control the process and read metrics from Raspberry PI. Data from Raspberry PI will be later visualized using charts. The presentation goes through all steps of building such solution.
Presentation page: http://gunnarpeipman.com/presentations/brewing-eisbock-with-raspberry-pi-and-windows-10-iot/

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning  (part 3)
sessions.description: Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects. You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: What about Azure IoT Hub
sessions.description:
In this session we will take a look on how we can integrate Azure IoT Hub in our solutions. At the begining we will start with a simple scenario that will evolve until we will reach the limits of IoT Hub. 
Yes, Azure IoT Hub is not perfect, this is way we will take a look on what are the limitations and workarounds for it. 
If you are working with devices or you want to find more about IoT Hub, this sessesion will unreveal  the secrests of Azure IoT Hub.

sessions.title: Dealing with Stakeholders - What Matters the Most?
sessions.description: What is the most important thing about stakeholders management? What does the theory say and how does reality speak for itself.

sessions.title: Human-Machine Interactions
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence in action.

sessions.title: Be more than a BA
sessions.description: Seek out ways to go above and beyond your role every day: do requirements engineering not requirements gathering, do not settle for the obvious, challenge every word, don't take everything for granted, make suggestions, provide alternatives, take decisions. Be proactive.

sessions.title: Actor based concurrency with Elixir
sessions.description:
Because of increased demand for interconnected systems(IOT, SAAS) we need new improved ways of handling reliable (soft)real-time systems. One battle-tested approach is based on the Actor Model pioneered by Erlang and brought to the masses by Elixir.

Topics that will be covered:
– actor model concurrency: why is it needed, advantages & disadvantages
- Elixir agents
– OTP patterns for handling agents: GenServer & Supervisor

sessions.title: Decisions. How to manage it
sessions.description:
Management of teams, projects, daily life rely heavily on the process of making decisions. 
How you are taking decisions, how you manage the process together with you team, what can you do to make things faster and more efficient you can learn from two experienced managers and entrepreneurs: Laura Birhala and Gabi Manole

sessions.title: The Raffle: Come and Win Your Prizes!
The entire CodeCamp community - After party

speakers.name: Silviu Niculita
speakers.bio:
Silviu Niculita is a passionate software developer and CTO focused on solving hard business problems with cutting-edge technology.

For the last 8 years he has managed teams building and operating high-performance enterprise systems from hardware architecture to design, development, quality assurance and support.

speakers.name: Gunnar Peipman
speakers.bio: Gunnar Peipman is experienced software developer and active .NET community member from Tallinn, Estonia. Gunnar has grown up with coding and has worked on different Microsoft platforms and technologies right from primary school. Having seen technologies coming, going and evolving Gunnar has deep understanding of Microsoft technologies.

speakers.name: Radu Vunvulea
speakers.bio: Radu Vunvulea is software architect at iQuest, working on LoB application using Microsoft technologies. He has a vast experience on different platforms from mobile and web to backend solution deployed on on-premise and in the cloud.

speakers.name: Florin Cardasim
speakers.bio:
Florin is a software architect and Agile coach. Beyond his technical skills, he gained a broad experience as a trainer for companies and speaker in conferences and community events.
Passionate by technology and by working with people to grow amazing things. Focused on people, quality and on-time delivery, while carefully looking to foster innovation and unleash the fun out of the software development.

speakers.name: Adrian Rîndaşu
speakers.bio: Adrian co founded Edurom in 2002. Since then, he developed and delivered training and consultancy programs for various companies in the software development industry. He is running Belbin & Situational Leadership trainings for the IT&C clients of Edurom.

speakers.name: Alex Moldovan
speakers.bio: Coder, blogger and tech enthusiast in general, passionate about JavaScript and Functional Programming, Alex works as a Full Stack Developer and is heavily involved into the JavaScript community, co-organizing Cluj JavaScripters. He always puts passion first in all his endeavours and is a militant for clean code and quality software development.

speakers.name: Andreea Popescu
speakers.bio: Curious speaker, usability specialist passionate about photography, (neuro)science and nature.

speakers.name: Andrei Diaconu
speakers.bio: Android has been a passion for me for many years. So much so, that I cofounded Android Iasi and GDG Iasi just to meet other people interested in building Android apps. Speaking at events like Codecamp or teaching Android to other people is something I do a few times every year.

speakers.name: Andrei Sebastian Cîmpean
speakers.bio:
Eons ago, when the universe was still a cold, dark place, I started programming in 48 BASIC. Then came the light, while as a student I dabbled stubbornly with C++ instead of Java.

Dynamic languages started to grow on me after college and now I fancy myself a full stack web developer. 

Although most of my energy goes into delivering ambitious js apps, I’m a software geek with strong opinions about technology, about how a successful product should be built and what makes a great team.

speakers.name: Bogdan Balomirean
speakers.bio: Certified Professional Scrum Product Owner with more than 7 years’ experience in different IT projects for a variety of customers coming from different business areas I have developed a strong experience in analysing, planning, monitoring and successfully delivering software applications and/or software improvements. My Bachler and Master's degree are both in Information Technology (Business IT).

speakers.name: Camelia Codarcea
speakers.jobTitle: Cofounder AgileHub,  Trainer and Agile Coach
speakers.bio:
Camelia, one of the three cofounders of AgileHub, is passionate about leadership, public speaking and human interaction.

Her main activities are coaching one:one as well as guiding and coaching companies and teams into their agile journey.  Creating trust through vulnerability and empathy is something that she really believes in.  

 She is convinced that in the right environment people are eager for excellency, so her work is to help create that environment.

speakers.name: Cristina Morariu
speakers.bio:
Cristina has obtained the MSc. degree in Computer Science in 2006 at Technical University of Cluj-Napoca and in 2013 obtained her PhD. degree in automatic control at University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Automatic Control and Computer Science. 

She is the mother of two, passionate about Tarantino movies and Artificial Intelligence. 

As a day to day job, Cristina is a project manager.

speakers.name: Dana Aonofriesei
speakers.bio:
Technology addicted, passionate QA Lead, curious tester.

Active member of Tabara de Testare Bucuresti.

speakers.name: Delora Balomirean
speakers.bio: Delora Balomirean has worked in the role of Business Analyst and Product Owner for over 7 years, on different IT projects for a number of companies coming from different business areas. Her domain experience covers Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Management (ERP). She is a certified PSPO and had worked both in an Agile and Waterfall environment.

speakers.name: Dolores Pente
speakers.bio: Dolly Pente is a software tester. Working with Altom has facilitated her induction into the context driven and exploratory testing. She is continuously trying to improve her abilities by learning and exploring new fields that can help her evolve both on a professional and personal level.  Dolly is an active member of the community Tabara de Testare and she enjoys attending different local conferences and meetups.

speakers.name: FĂTULESCU Corneliu Constantin
speakers.bio:
Co-founder of AgileHub, ScriuCod and CTO @Pentalog, blogger @www.cornel.fatulescu.ro, Cornel FĂTULESCU is a passionate Father and Agile Coach. With more than 18 exciting years in the IT world, Cornel ventures promotes safety, love and compassion in everyone’s journey to excellence. 
As an agile advocate, he optimized business value delivered within various large scale organizations by implementing XP, Scrum, Kanban, LeSS.

speakers.name: Gabriel Manole
speakers.bio:
Passionate in management and software development, Gabriel Manole brings together the experience of working with large teams and developing managers.
Co-founder of m.IT Iasi - the community of managers in IT, and summIT Romania, the conference where passionate managers from Romanian companies come to meet and learn from the best speakers.
about leadership and IT management.

speakers.name: Magdas Adrian
speakers.bio:
Journeyman software craftsman always looking for better ways to create software.
Interested in functional programming languages, performance optimization, concurrent and parallel execution techniques. 
Eager to learn/apply extreme programming practices like pair programming and TDD in order to produce better design and code.

speakers.name: Popa Elena-Georgeta
speakers.bio: Elena has been working as a software tester for the past 4 years in different companies and contexts.

speakers.name: Radu Iscu
speakers.bio: Radu has been a software professional for a while now. He's worked on both small and large projects, small and large companies, and in this time he's learned a lot of stuff about code. He's passionate about extreme programming, flexible design, emergent architecture and refactoring, to the point where he won't stop talking about it.

speakers.name: Rares Vasilescu
speakers.bio:
Software builder by practice, human by design.
Passionate about solving actual problems through software, self learner but also with a PhD in Computer Science.
Geek, and also into management..,
C++ rocks! And did I mention that the greatest success we had with Java teams?
